page.title: 15Food in Evie
page.content: Some old traditional food is still made e.g.{Salted Pork.}A mixture of salt and brown sugar is rubbed into the pork everyday for 3 days, then the pork is left outside for a week, turning it everyday.{Skelpies:} beremeal, salt and kirn milk is mixed together then baked on a yetleen (girdle).{Brose:}hot water is poured onto oatmeal, then supped with milk. Very common local foods include{ {Clapshot:}potatoes and turnip cooked together and mashed up;{Bere Bannocks: scones made from beremeal and wheatflour;{Farmhouse Cheese}and{ {Butter}made in a hand churn. Seafood is important. {Cuithes}and{ {Ling}are split, salted and sun-dried in the gardens. {Partans}(crabs),{ {Lobsters,Spouts}(razor fish) and{ {Whelks}are all seafoods eaten locally.
